website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix S230 is a decent ultracompact camera with a little extra wow factor of a touch-screen interface.
pros: overall excellent design for its class

customer_reviews.title: The battery doesn't hold a charge and the camera won't ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesn't hold a charge and the camera won't record for more than 30 seconds..I am completely unhappy with this product and unable to return. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paigii

customer_reviews.title: It may be broken
customer_reviews.text: I think of this product like I think of a used car. It could look good on the outside but it really experienced hale damage & the engine is 200 miles from needing a total overhaul. I have not been able to take a single picture with this camera yet. I'm going to search for a better camera on Amazon. I will not give up.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa G

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix
customer_reviews.text: This item is just what was ordered. The pictures are almost perfect and I love the color and touch pad. It is so easy to use that my granddaughter wants one just like it. Included in the package was battery, charger, usb and clear instructions. I am extremely happy with this purchase and will recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera with excellent picture quality, especially for the price. The camera itself has several different options for shooting and it is somewhat simple. It is very sleek and the portability is great! It weighs next to nothing and fits pretty much anywhere you would carry a phone. The only con to this product is the touch screen. I am so used to my iPhone touchscreen being glass, this one feels like plastic. It just seems cheap and it lacks sensitivity, sometimes I find myself mashing on it way too hard to get it to work. Other than that, overall A+!
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my mom for Christmas. She opened it up and was taking pictures 5 minutes later. Her eyesight isn't great, so the huge screen helps her see what she's shooting, and the touchscreen makes navigating the controls simple too. She loves it, and the pictures look great.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this from the Amazon open box warehouse and it works perfect and looks like new. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several HP and Kodak camera's in the past but this is the first time I've owned/tried a Nikon and must say that it's the best by far. I love the touch screen and the option of being able to write your messages right onto the picture. I would definitely purchase from Nikon again.
customer_reviews.author: MPDB, Birmingham, AL

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Canon less than a year ago and hated it. It was to slow due to the regular batteries. Fed up, I researched and found this one. This camara is easy, fast and takes great photos for the low cost. Love the touchscreen thought sometimes it can be fussy.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a previous Nikon Coolpix camera in Europe and loved it. When I lost that one I replaced it with this one. The pictures were poor. Its stopped holding a charge. The touch screen was not intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Little

customer_reviews.title: Nikkon Touch Scream.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the worst camera I have ever used. The quality of the picture on the touch screen is grainy and very poor. I spent hours adjusting settings and could not improve the quality. Even when connected to the high def TV the quality was awful. I returned this camera and purchased a Cannon that is awesome. Maybe I just got stuck with a lemon Nikon but that just shows that their quality control is poor. I don't think I will ever buy another Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Norman A. Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Got to love a Nikon
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd. digital camera, my last one was a Nikon, and I was happy with it until I dropped it...:( I checked the CoolPix out and many stores. One day I saw it on Amazon, the price was excellent, and I saw FREE SHIPPING. BINGO....I hit the order button.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter and she has never complained so it must be good! we have had it for 2 years now without a problem and it takes great pics.
customer_reviews.author: monkeldad

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera with nice features
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a Christmas gift for my wife and she loved it. Even though it's not iPhone-like touch screen, there's still the feeling that you can do everything with your fingers. The fact that it has very few buttons, makes the screen bigger, plus the camera itslef is very lightweight. There are still more features that we haven't explored, but we like what we've seen so far, including the smile mode and the continuous shots.
customer_reviews.author: Pato Arvizu

customer_reviews.title: nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: just what we wanted . very easy , small, with alot of nice features. pictures turn out great ! thanks
customer_reviews.author: SHamill

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S230
customer_reviews.text: I love this Camara!!! The best feature on it is that you can hold the button down and take 6 consecutive pictures making it great for catching the right shot with a moving grandchild. I find that when I use that feature I get several shots that I want to keep and delete the ones that I don't.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves her new camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased that the camera was very well cared for and all of its' components were included in the original box. The seller also included a separate camera case - thanks for the extra!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Just the perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. The camera is so thin that perfectly fits in her pocket. She also indicated that it is so easy to use. By the way, she is only 13 years old.
customer_reviews.author: MARICOR

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my Sister for Christmas and It is an awesome camera. I own the S60 (which is more expensive) and the S230's picture quality and responsiveness is superior.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Ponciano

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality rate it at 5 on a 100 point scale
customer_reviews.text: There couldn't be a worse performing camera than this. We have a D200 that we use for most occasions; and got this to keep with us for a european trip; and boy we couldn't have done our selves a worse service when it came to capturing memories. The quality of pictures is extremely poor for all kinds of pictures. There's really nothing more to say for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gagan Chopra

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Glory to God in the highest. Thank you for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: oscar devera

customer_reviews.title: light and simple
customer_reviews.text: the camera is quick and easy to use and compact. It is well worth the money for the technology. Its my second nikon and by far the best in its price range. I was also able to get a second battery for 6 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: technowizz

customer_reviews.title: Super poor digital camera
customer_reviews.text: As soon as receive that item, I try to use that camera but it's quality is too poor, so, I disappointed about Nikon camera and I never again buy this brand camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sanghee Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pictures! No More Green Food Photos!
customer_reviews.text: One of my daughters, knowing that I had become very frustrated with the AA-battery powered point & shoot that has been turning all of my food photos green and using up an entire set of batteries every time I transferred pictures to the computer for processing recently gave me thisand I've been having a lot of fun with it. (No more green food photos!) is easy to learn to use, takes both stills and video and features a large touch screen (no reading glasses required.) Lightweight, it easily fits into a purse. The removable battery is rechargeable and pictures are easily transferred to your computer or printer. Grandma's $0.02 - Love this easy-to-use camera.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Plain Awful
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very nice compact camera. There are many settings for the user to choose from. The navigation is good. The LCD screen is bright and large. However, the pictures are awful. Several of the settings are useless. Fireworks, for example, has such a long exposure time, that you need a tripod for it to get a crisp picture. And this thing is tiny, so it would look ridiculous on any tripod, even a gorilla pod. Any night pictures are hideous and grainy. Adding digital zoom makes things awful. And the while balance is very off. I should have kept my old cannon, as it took much better pictures.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tomaszewski

customer_reviews.title: Picture Quality Surprise
customer_reviews.text: I got this Camera for my birthday back in October and was exited to get to use it. But shortly after I opened it, I was a little discouraged. The picture quality was not good at all. Most of the time it would be "grainy" or quite blurry. And even if the picture looked good on the big touch screen, once I put them onto my laptop the quality became even worse. The indoor quality was the worse of all the settings (which is where I use it the most), but the only upside was it did wonderful in natural, bright light. Overall as my second point-and-shoot camera, I was unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Pitsas

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! For a novice, it's great for my needs and it's also my first one. My BF has a Nikon and I loved it. SO FAR SO GREAT! .... It's loaded with goodies and does the job. Lighweight, cute and FUN! What else do I need?? Cheers! gabi
customer_reviews.author: Miriam G. #007

customer_reviews.title: Far from the Best
customer_reviews.text: This isn't that great of a camera. The touch-screen barely works. You have to press it a million times for it to MAYBE recognize what you're trying to click. Another really annoying thing is that you can't get pictures off the camera the same way you can with every other digital camera. They make you use their awful Nikon Transfer software, which doesn't even recognize the camera when I plug it in, which means I can't get anything off of the camera. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LakeHMM

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a brainless alternative to my full-featured high end DSLR. Guess which one comes with me everywhere? It's so easy to shoot with this little pocket camera, and so guiltless. Easy to use, small and convenient. I have no issues with the image quality. Then again, I know what the high end looks like, so maybe my expectations are more reasonable. You gets what you pays for - and I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera for Mother's Day. I've been frustrated with my old one because the shutter wasn't quick enough to keep up with my 2 year old and her baby brother, so my husband bought this one because we like touch screens and it was 10 MP (my old one is 7). The shutter speed is definitely quicker, but every picture I take is blurry, the screen is grainy, and the movies are also low quality. It's boxed up, ready to go back. We're going to try a Cannon instead.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Why Nikon? Why?
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is, I'm very disappointed. I feel like I bought a product that should still be in R&D. Nikon should never release a product when it's not ready for prime time. My biggest complaint is the picture quality in low light conditions. It's grainy and blurry. Even my 6 yr old Sony Cybershot performed better. Nikon is really ruining their reputation when they release a product of such low quality. The only thing that I liked was the touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yee

customer_reviews.title: horrible picture quality!
customer_reviews.text: My dad just got one as a graduation gift for my cousin. We tried to take a few photos to test it and the picture quality was horrid. I cannot believe in this day and age Nikon would make something so inferior and dare to put their name on it. I own a Nikon D50, have owned Canon S30, A90 and Canon A570 IS. All of them take pictures with qualities WAY better than this S230. I do not recommend this camera! Dad will return this camera tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gong

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I am very dissapointed with this camera. When I got my 1st one it had a dent on the front. I returned it and I got a new one in the mail a few days later. I was happy with this one until it got a crack in the screen. Now I can't delete photos, or edit them. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C. Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen is nice to have, but HORRIBLE picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Indoor and Outdoor pictures are very noisy/grainy. A lot of the pictures were severely out of focus (even at the point where the camera shows it focused). Outdoor performance is better than indoor, but still very poor. I bought the Canon 790IS (same price as Nikon at Costco) to do comparison shots. The 790IS outperformed the Nikon in all departments. Don't waste your money and time on Nikon s230.
customer_reviews.author: H. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen is cool, the color is nice but the quality of the pictures is horrible. The Macro feature doesn't allow you to get close to the object. The pictures when viewed on the camera screen are grainy so I uploaded them to my computer where they were just as bad. I tried every setting, every light option...it is just an overall poor quality picture. I am trying to get rid of it for a better camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: very happy with my item i contacted the vendor before shipping and received my camera before the ship date very good experience
customer_reviews.author: Letty Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most horrible-quality you can buy with your money. I don't know where the 10MP are, but certainly not in this camera. The pictures are grainy and just overall awful. I played around with the settings not no avail. A 1.3MP camera yields better pictures. I returned this item the next day. Will never purchase a camera over the Internet unless I go to a store and test it first. Just trust me, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible pictures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a gift for my daughter. After reading the previous review, I decided to take a few trial pictures before giving it as the gift. All the pictures that were taken indoors with and without flash were not focused correctly. The pictures that were taken outside were OK. However, for a brand new camera that is not necessary a steal in price you should be able to expect better pictures. I have never had a problem with any of my other cameras. Too bad, as it appeared to be a fun camera with all the specials. We sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: G. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Pictures not clear
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased with the quality of the pictures this camera produced. I tried all the different settings and no matter what I did the pictures were grainy and not crisp. I returned the camera to the company I purchased it from.
customer_reviews.author: Sue W. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Austin Kucher should go back to That 70's Show
customer_reviews.text: This camera stinks, aweful pics. Also its hard to hold on to. Sucks, buy a canon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too soon to review
customer_reviews.text: the novelty of the touch screen is great but the intricacies of the camera are still an exploration for me...
customer_reviews.author: Grammy PJ

customer_reviews.title: Nikon made a mistake with camera....
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are grainy... everything else is ok, but the pictures come up crappy! I have a 7mp camera that takes better pictures then this camera. The color is cute, but I suggest not getting it. I tried everything to see if the picture could be sharper, but nothing works. Don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: MaiduCali

customer_reviews.title: The worst image quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera looks very cute. But the image quality is the worst. I never knew that different brands of camera could have so big quality differences; how can a camera survive with this image quality? It's even not cheap among this category of camera.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yu

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix S230 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 3 inch Touch Panel LCD (Plum)
product_meta.description:
Color:PlumFROM THE MANUFACTURER


Nikon’s slim, stylish Coolpix S230 combines 10.0 effective megapixels with an amazing 3.0-inch high-resolution touch-panel LCD for taking and sharing great pictures. The Coolpix S230 has a 3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens and combined with Nikon’s 4-Way VR Image Stabilization gets you sharp pictures with a touch of ease. The Coolpix S230, with Nikon’s EXPEED image processor and new Smart Portrait System also enables you to get incredible pictures, incredibly easy. Nikon’s Scene Auto Selector automatically analyzes the scene you are taking and adjusts the scene mode for you. All you have to do is compose and click! 

Coolpix S230 Highlights 

10.0-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches 

3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens provides exceptional pictures and gets you close to the action 

New EXPEED image processor ensures high-quality pictures with stunning color and sharpness 

4-Way VR Image stabilization

 * Nikon’s Electronic VR image stabilization compensates for the effects of camera shake by adjusting the shutter speed and the ISO to get the optimal results 
 * Motion Detection automatically detects moving subjects and adjusts shutter speed and the ISO setting to compensate for cameras hake and subject movement 
 * High ISO up to 2000 capability helps give you sharper results when shooting in low light or capturing fast-moving subjects. 
 * Nikon’s original Best Shot Selector (BSS) automatically takes up to 10 shots while the shutter is pressed and saves the sharpest image 

3.0-inch high-resolution touch-panel LCD enables easy access to all the camera controls without the conventional buttons to push. The anti-reflection coating that is applied to the touch panel enhances viewing even in bright light 

Scene Auto Selector automatically recognizes the scene in your picture and adjusts camera setting 

Nikon’s Smart Portrait System:  * Smile Mode The camera automatically takes the shot when the subject smiles 
 * Blink proof camera automatically takes two shots and saves the one in which the subject’s eye are open 
 * In-Camera Red-Eye Fix automatically fixes most instances of red-eye in the camera. You may never see red-eye again 
 * Enhanced Face-Priority AF - Nikon’s face-finding technology that automatically focuses on faces faster than ever. Up to 12 faces can be detected and Face priority AE adjusts brightness of the subject’s face 
 * D-Lighting rescues dark or backlit images by improving brightness and detail where needed
feature_bullets: 10.0-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 16 x 20 inches
3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens; 4-way VR image stabilization
Nikon's Smart Portrait System; Red-eye Fix, Face Priority AE and more
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars69 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
